alert.note: Alert for Rio Arriba; San Juan (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Dust Storm Warning issued March 04 at 4:52PM MST until March 04 at 5:45PM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a * Dust Storm Warning for... Northwestern Rio Arriba County in north central New Mexico... Central San Juan County in northwestern New Mexico... * Until 545 PM MST. * At 451 PM MST, a wall of dust was along a line extending from 20 miles south of Mancos to 11 miles northeast of Blanco Trading Post, moving north at 50 mph. HAZARD...Less than a quarter mile visibility with strong wind in excess of 50 mph. SOURCE...Satellite. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. * This includes the following highways... Highway 550 between Mile Markers 106 and 174. Highway 64 between Mile Markers 34 and 111. Locations impacted include... Farmington, Kirtland, Bloomfield, Aztec, Navajo Dam, Nageezi, NAPI Headquarters, Fruitland, Upper Fruitland and Lake Valley. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Dust storms create dangerous driving conditions with visibility reduced to near zero. If you encounter a dust storm, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake. Motorists should not drive into a dust storm. PULL ASIDE STAY ALIVE!
